hypothesis_content.title: Asia Session Liquidity Gap Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR or STRESS regimes, a BTC price decline of >3% occurring specifically during the Asia trading session (00:00-08:00 UTC) that finds support at the prior day's low will reverse by 50-70% during the London/early US overlap (08:00-14:00 UTC) as Western liquidity absorbs oversold conditions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear/stress regimes see thin Asia session liquidity amplify sell-offs. If the drop holds key technical levels (prior day low), it suggests exhaustion. Western institutional and algorithmic flows at London open often provide a liquidity bounce for tactical reversals.
entry_conditions: Price holds above prior day's low (no breakdown)
4-hour candle at 08:00 UTC shows a lower wick >1.5% of candle range (buying evidence)
Enter on the first 1-hour close above the 08:00 UTC 4-hour candle's open

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the Asia session decline
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the prior day's low
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14:00 UTC same day (London/early US session close)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 40% of such Asia session declines see a 50% retracement by 14:00 UTC in bear/stress regimes over 50+ signals.
